org.jtrim.access

Class AccessAvailabilityNotifier<RightType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jtrim.access.AccessAvailabilityNotifier<RightType>
  • Type Parameters:
    RightType -
    Deprecated. 
    Use boolean properties instead with AutoDisplayState.

    An AccessAvailabilityNotifier can keep track of the availability of group of rights and notify listeners when a change occurs. The AccessAvailabilityNotifier must be create by the static attach method and the newly created instance will then keep track of the changes of the rights of the passed AccessManager.

    Once you have created an instance of AccessAvailabilityNotifier, you may then specify group of rights and action to executed when the availability of these rights changes. That is, if they all become available, or if they cannot be acquired due to one or more rights being unavailable.

    Thread safety

    Instances of AccessAvailabilityNotifier are safe to be accessed from multiple threads concurrently.

    Synchronization transparency

    Methods of this interface are not synchronization transparent but they do not wait for any external event. That is, they return relatively quickly.

    @Deprecated
public final class AccessAvailabilityNotifier<RightType>
extends java.lang.Object
    See Also:
    attach(AccessManager)

    • Method Detail

      • attach

        public static <IDType,RightType> AccessAvailabilityNotifier<RightType> attach(AccessManager<IDType,RightType> manager)
        Deprecated. 
        Creates a new instance of AccessAvailabilityNotifier which will keep track of changes in the availability of the subsequently added right groups.

        This method will register a listener with the specified AccessManager and you may cause the returned AccessAvailabilityNotifier to unregister this added listener. Note however, that doing so will stop the AccessAvailabilityNotifier from keeping track of the changes of the availability right groups. That is, all the added right groups will be unregistered (even if they are added later).

        Type Parameters:
        IDType - the type of the request ID (see AccessRequest.getRequestID())
        RightType - the type of the rights that can be managed by the given AccessManager
        Parameters:
        manager - the AccessManager managing the rights and determining if the rights are available or not. This argument cannot be null
        Returns:
        a new instance of AccessAvailabilityNotifier which will keep track of changes in the availability of the subsequently added right groups. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified AccessManager is null
        See Also:
        detach()

      • multiAction

        public static AccessChangeAction multiAction(AccessChangeAction... actions)
        Deprecated. 
        Creates an AccessChangeAction which when notified, notifies all the AccessChangeAction instances specified in the arguments.

        Even if an AccessChangeAction throws an exception, other AccessChangeAction instances will still be notified. However, the first exception thrown by the underlying AccessChangeAction instances will be rethrown to the caller of the AccessChangeAction returned by this method. If more than one AccessChangeAction throws an exception others will be suppressed.

        Parameters:
        actions - the AccessChangeAction instance to be called by the returned AccessChangeAction. This argument and its elements cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the AccessChangeAction which when notified, notifies all the AccessChangeAction instances specified in the arguments. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the argument or one of its element is null

      • addGroupListener

        public ListenerRef addGroupListener(java.util.Collection<? extends RightType> readRights,
                           java.util.Collection<? extends RightType> writeRights,
                           AccessChangeAction accessChangeAction)
        Deprecated. 
        Adds a group of rights which this AccessAvailabilityNotifier must monitor for availability. Whenever the availability of the group of rights changes, the specified AccessChangeAction is invoked to take the appropriate action.
        Parameters:
        readRights - the Collection of rights for which read access is required. Read access is granted to a particular right if there is no conflicting write access. This argument can be null which is equivalent to passing an empty Collection. The content of this passed Collection is copied by this method and modifying the Collection after this method has no effect on this AccessAvailabilityNotifier.
        writeRights - the Collection of rights for which write access is required. Read access is granted to a particular right if there is no conflicting write or read access. This argument can be null which is equivalent to passing an empty Collection. The content of this passed Collection is copied by this method and modifying the Collection after this method has no effect on this AccessAvailabilityNotifier.
        accessChangeAction - the listener to be notified when the availability of the specified rights changes. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the ListenerRef which can be used to stop listening for the currently specified group of rights. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified accessChangeAction is null
        See Also:
        multiAction(AccessChangeAction[])

      • detach

        public void detach()
        Deprecated. 
        Stops keeping track of the changes in the availability of rights. That is, unregisters all the added right groups.

        This method will make this AccessAvailabilityNotifier useless but this method might be useful if you need to unregister the listener added to the underlying AccessManager.
